SENT.plain: We report an uncommon case of an insulin-treated diabetic patient, presenting severe hypoglycemia, coma, marked sinus bradycardia and QT prolongation
Intravenous administration of glucose and atropine awaked the patient and increased heart rate but did not affect QT prolongation
Basal and exercise electrocardiogram excluded primary diseases associated with QT prolongation
Pathophysiologic aspects of electrocardiographic and clinical findings occurring in the hypoglycemic patients are briefly discussed
